Name: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to report on the incidence of food-borne illness.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to report on the incidence of food-borne illness.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health

RTF:
{\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1033{\fonttbl{\f0\froman\fprq2\fcharset0 Times New Roman;}{\f1\fnil\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}}
{\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;\red255\green255\blue255;}
\viewkind4\uc1
\v0\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\sl480\slmult1\qj\ul Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. Chapter 1 of title 17 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 17-198 to read as follows:\par
\cf1\ul\b\'a7 \cf0 17-198 Report on food-borne illness. \b0 a. Beginning January 15, 2013, and on or before every January 15 thereafter, the department shall submit to the council a written report that shall provide information about the incidence of food-borne illness in New York city for the preceding calendar year. Such report shall include a list of the five most common food-borne illnesses in New York city. Such report shall also include, but not be limited to, the following information, disaggregated by each of the five such illnesses:\par
1. the number of individuals that suffered from food-borne illness in New York city, disaggregated by borough;\par
2. the number of individuals that presented to emergency departments with food-borne illness or symptoms of food-borne illness, disaggregated by borough;\par
3. the number of hospitalizations attributed to food-borne illness, disaggregated by borough;\par
4. the number of deaths attributed to food-borne illness, disaggregated by borough;\par
5. the origin of the food which caused the food-borne illness;\par
6. the type of food which caused the food-borne illness;\par
7. the location where such food was sold, consumed or prepared, including but not limited to, a private residence, food service establishment, mobile food vendor, catering hall, or any other location where food is served;\par
8. the number of investigations conducted by the department pertaining to food-borne illness, disaggregated by borough;\par
9. a summary of such investigations conducted by the department; and\par
10. information on the prevention of food-borne illness.\par
b. Each annual report prepared pursuant to subdivision a of this section shall be made available to the public on the department\rquote s website. \par
\ulnone\'a7 2. This local law shall take effect ninety days after its enactment.\par
